In Johnny Pesky, Boston loses icon

The foul pole, the retired number, and the statue are well-deserved, but we don’t need them to remind us of Boston baseball’s nicest guy.

Fans remember Pesky as 'old guard'

Over six decades, Johnny Pesky earned fans’ affection and admiration as a sparkplug infielder, manager, broadcaster, coach, and executive.

Boston extends youth summer jobs program another week

Most of the 3,340 Boston teenagers working in a summer employment program will be able to stay on the job for an extra week.

SEC shows how weak it is

When the commission said it won’t sue Goldman Sachs over an awful subprime deal, it revealed the ineffectiveness of the laws that are supposed protect the economy.
